titleStmt.title: Efficient Sampling for Bipartite Matching Problems

analytic.title: Efficient Sampling for Bipartite Matching Problems

abstract.p: Bipartite matching problems characterize many situations, ranging from ranking in information retrieval to correspondence in vision. Exact inference in real-world applications of these problems is intractable, making efficient approximation methods essential for learning and inference. In this paper we propose a novel sequential matching sampler based on a generalization of the Plackett-Luce model, which can effectively make large moves in the space of matchings. This allows the sampler to match the difficult target distributions common in these problems: highly multimodal distributions with well separated modes. We present experimental results with bipartite matching problems-ranking and image correspondence-which show that the sequential matching sampler efficiently approximates the target distribution, significantly outperforming other sampling approaches.
